Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Jim Levin, Jean Elizabeth Glass, and Lou Maletta, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund2. Short news stories3. Interview with Lou Maletta on the Stonewall Riots of June 28th, 1969COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser4. Continuation of discussion about the effects of Stonewall on the current gay community and gay advocacyCOMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund5. Andy Humm on Bishop Emerson Moore and his hypocrisy speaking against gay rights as a gay man6. News Watch, the Boston Lesbian and Gay Alliance is pushing for the city to hire gays as police due to a seven-fold increase in violence against homosexuals7. 6 year study in Sweden allows for the passage of a bill granting long-term homosexual couples the same rights as common law marriages8. Police wear bright yellow gloves to arrest pro-gay protesters in Washington DC, but South Carolinian police wear anti-AIDS suits against the perceived treat of contracting the virus9. The Beastie Boys made anti-gay comments in a music magazine, so their recording label, CBS Records, donated $2000 to the Gay and Lesbian Anti-Violence ProjectCOMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine10. Sports Report11. Lavender Health, interview with Aaron Rudner, Deafness Project Director at the Institute for the Protection of Lesbian and Gay Youth12. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. Olivia Negron interviews Peggy Shaw and Lois Weaver, two founders of the lesbian performance troupe, "Split Britches"COMMERCIAL: The Monster2. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of cabaret show, "The Wallowitching Hour"3. Rebroadcast of Episode 8 of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "Fit for a Queen"4. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, announcement of playwright Charles Ludlam's death, clips from a performance of his play, "The Ventriloquist's Wife"5. Olivia Negron announces important numbers to call, closing credits
